content.description: Climb the face while following the bolt line.
content.location: First bolted route to the right of April Fool

content.description: Short, fun and slightly fingery route near the end of the bluff
content.location: Third sport route from the far right side of Cedar Bluff

content.description: Climb the chimney crack to the left of Schoolyard Blues
content.location: Chimney crack to the left of Schoolyard Blues

content.description: Fun face climb with a wild roof!

Ascend the right leaning seam that goes up a slab and continue with it as it becomes vertical, followed by going through a small open book gully. Continue until you reach a small ledge before you reach the top.
content.protection: Trad gear of varied sizes + bolted anchor
content.location: Starts 10ish feet to the right of Big Sting

content.description: Route on bulge just left of Dos Equis.  A bouldery start leads to relaxed climbing with not exactly ideal gear placements; get creative with mid size cams and nuts.  Joins with Dos Equis last two bolts to the anchors.
content.protection: Doubles of Small to mid size cams and nuts. 2 QD plus anchors
content.location: Just left of Dos Equis.   Rap off dos Equis anchors

content.description:
Ascend the shallow, easy looking gully above a low roof.  

  "Go Ahead, Make 'Em Dance"-E. Ulner
content.location: About 50 feet right of Hypothermia. The route ascends the gully.

content.description: Ascend the slab/face next to a tree 12ish feet left of the actual bolt line. Traverse into the route and make careful moves until you traverse under an overhung arete. Ascend the upper arete and eventually reach the anchor.
content.location: The sport route to the right of Those Bear Memorial

content.description:
Pitch 1: (5.8) Climb up the gully until you reach the base of the arete. Build a belay here. 

  Pitch 2: (5.10a) Traverse the dihedral crack (don't forget to clip the bolt) up and left to the next gully and belay at the tree. 

  Descent: 4th class out from here, or rappel from the tree
content.protection: Set of cams and nuts + 1 QD
content.location: Begins at the base of the gully to the right of Jack In The Green

content.description: Climb the large rounded arete with a psychological crux at 2/3 height
content.protection: 3 quickdraws plus some medium sized gear
content.location: around the corner from the fully bolted "Schoolyard Blues" (about 70 feet)

content.description: Follow the bolts to reach the anchor
content.location: First route to the right of St. Louis Graffiti

content.description: Head right look for the two X-like features in the rock about 15 feet up. A waist-high roof is underneath. Goes straight up.

climbs.name: Cool Down
climbs.fa: John Payne, according to Vertical Heartland guidebook

content.description: Enjoyable slab route. Starts with a crack in the middle. When that ends, you work your way left a tiny bit to a crack on that side.
content.protection:
Cams .3-.75, two bolts + bolted anchor.  

  The anchors are accessible via the walkup to the east. You'll probably want somebody down at the bottom of the route to shout up to you so you know when you're in the right spot. Also, probably a good idea to anchor yourself to a tree in some way before heading out on the ledge to set up a top rope.
content.location: A short ways to the east of "St Louis Graffiti." A short ways west of the 2nd class walk-up.

content.description: Climb the crack system "gully" protecting when necessary and eventually top the bluff out.
content.protection: Trad gear of varied sizes + bolted anchor
content.location: the crack just right of Ghosts and Goblins

climbs.name: Big Sting
climbs.fa: Jeff Scheff, John Payne, Brian Vana 1985

content.description:
If necessary, use the oak tree to access the slab. Climb the slab to the right facing dihedral crack inside of the overhang. Once in, climb with the feature and top out on the left.  

  Jeff stirred the wasps, John made them mad, Brian got nailed!
content.protection: Trad gear of varied sizes + bolted anchor
content.location: 30ish feet to the right of Ghosts and Goblins

climbs.name: April Fool
climbs.fa: John Payne Greg Simons, Frank Borzager

content.description: Climb the leftward angling dihedral feature
content.protection: Trad gear of varied sizes to the anchor
content.location: The dihedral feature to the left of Oily Easter Beaver

content.description: The right fork in the main trail leads directly to the Coal House Area.
